News.Title: Canara Robeco Reports 18% Revenue Growth in 9M FY26
News.Summary: Canara Robeco Asset Management Company delivered strong financial performance with total revenue of INR310.7 crores in 9M FY26, up 18% YoY, while AUM reached INR1.2 lakh crores with over 50 lakh investor folios.

News.Title: Canara Robeco Q3FY26 PAT Rises 10.2% to ₹527.54 Cr
News.Summary: Canara Robeco Asset Management reported Q3FY26 PAT of ₹527.54 crores, up 10.2% YoY. Revenue from operations grew 14.3% to ₹1,097.70 crores. Board appointed new Chairman and granted 14.55 lakh stock options.

News.Title: Canara Robeco: Chairman K Satyanarayana Raju Resigns
News.Summary: K Satyanarayana Raju has resigned from his position as Chairman of the Board at Canara Robeco Asset Management Company, marking a significant leadership change at the mid-cap asset management firm.

News.Title: Canara Robeco Chairman K Satyanarayana Raju Resigns
News.Summary: K Satyanarayana Raju resigned as Non-Executive Director and Chairman of Canara Robeco Asset Management Company due to superannuation from Canara Bank CEO role, effective December 31, 2025.

News.Title: Canara Robeco Declares 1.50% Interim Dividend
News.Summary: Canara Robeco Asset Management Company declares interim dividend of ₹1.50 per equity share (15% of face value) with record date set for December 22, 2025, following board meeting held on December 16, 2025.

News.Title: Canara Robeco Asset Management Board to Consider Interim Dividend Declaration
News.Summary: Canara Robeco Asset Management Company Limited's Board of Directors will meet on December 16, 2025, to consider declaring an interim dividend and setting a record date for payment. The company has closed its trading window from December 11-18, 2025, for designated persons and their immediate relatives in compliance with insider trading regulations.

News.Title: Canara Robeco Asset Management Shareholders Approve Employee Stock Option Scheme and Promoter Rights via Postal Ballot
News.Summary: Canara Robeco Asset Management Company completed a postal ballot voting process on December 7, 2025, where shareholders approved two special resolutions with overwhelming majorities exceeding 99%. The approved resolutions include ratification of the CRAMC Employee Stock Option Scheme 2025 and approval of promoters' rights post-listing of equity shares, affecting the company's employee compensation structure and promoter shareholding arrangements.
